poem:
**Forecast of a Different Kind**

In the shadow of Lloyd's new dawn,  
where premiums rise like morning mist,  
the apolitical hand shakes  
with fossil whispers.  
Storms cough in the distance,  
their breath unseen,  
cloaked in the language of coverage,  
while coal sits waiting—  
a quiet anchor in the chaos,  
paid for in silent, burning scripts.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "New Lloyd’s boss signals shift on insuring fossil fuels The new chief executive of Lloyd’s has stressed the insurance market’s “apolitical” stance in an apparent shift on climate policy, even as he warned of growing threats from an acceleration of extreme weather events. Patrick Tiernan, who took over as CEO from John Neal in June, said the corporation would no longer discourage insurers operating in the market from underwriting coal and other fossil fuel projects.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
